DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Prior Taxane Compound Personal Medical History Stratification Factors Indicator Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no indicator whether there was prior use of a taxane compound in person medical history as a pre-treatment factor by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Prior Taxane Compound Personal Medical History Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior use of a taxane compound (a type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division), interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis), and are used to treat cancer), as part of a person medical history, an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced, as a pre-treatment factor by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredName: Prior Taxane Compound Personal Medical History Stratification Factors
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division. Also called antimitotic or antimicrotubule agents or mitotic inhibitors.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.:Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

Concepts.definition: A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
